reference: Online complements to Greene (2003). Table F22.2.
title: Fair's Extramarital Affairs Data
description:
Description
Infidelity data, known as Fair's Affairs. Cross-section data from a survey
conducted by Psychology Today in 1969.

parameters.occupation:
numeric variable coding occupation according to Hollingshead classification
(reverse numbering).
parameters.age:
numeric variable coding age in years: 17.5 = under 20, 22 = 20–24,
27 = 25–29, 32 = 30–34, 37 = 35–39, 42 = 40–44,
47 = 45–49, 52 = 50–54, 57 = 55 or over.
parameters.children: factor. Are there children in the marriage?
parameters.yearsmarried:
numeric variable coding number of years married: 0.125 = 3 months or less,
0.417 = 4–6 months, 0.75 = 6 months–1 year, 1.5 = 1–2 years,
4 = 3–5 years, 7 = 6–8 years, 10 = 9–11 years, 15 = 12 or more years.
parameters.education:
numeric variable coding level of education: 9 = grade school,
12 = high school graduate, 14 = some college, 16 = college graduate,
17 = some graduate work, 18 = master's degree, 20 = Ph.D., M.D., or
other advanced degree.
parameters.affairs:
numeric. How often engaged in extramarital sexual intercourse
during the past year? 0 = none, 1 = once, 2 = twice,
3 = 3 times, 7 = 4–10 times, 12 = monthly,
12 = weekly, 12 = daily.
parameters.rating:
numeric variable coding self rating of marriage: 1 = very unhappy,
2 = somewhat unhappy, 3 = average, 4 = happier than average, 
5 = very happy.
parameters.religiousness:
numeric variable coding religiousness: 1 = anti, 2 = not at all,
3 = slightly, 4 = somewhat, 5 = very.

format: A data frame containing 601 observations on 9 variables.
